translated: Āryajāṅgulītārāsādhana

original: bod skad du /
analyzed: bod skad du /
translated: In Tibetan:

analyzed: 'phags ma sgrol ma dug sel ma'i sgrub thabs /
translated: The Means of Attaining Noble Tārā, the Remover of Poison

analyzed: sgrol ma dug sel ma la phyag 'tshal lo // dz'am gu l'i yi gzugs 'dzin pa'i //
translated: Homage to Tārā, the Remover of Poison.🔽I pay homage to Bhagavatī Tārā,

original: bcom ldan sgrol ma la phyag 'tshal //
analyzed: bcom ldan sgrol ma la phyag 'tshal //
translated: who assumes the form of Jāṅgulī.

original: @151b sems can kun la brtse ba'i phyir //
analyzed: @151b sems can kun la brtse ba'i phyir //
translated: Out of love for all sentient beings,

original: de yi sgrub thabs mchog gyur bri //
analyzed: de yi sgrub thabs mchog gyur bri //
translated: I will write her supreme means of attainment.

original: dang por re zhig sngags pas gtsang zhing khrus byas nas phreng ba dang gos dkar po bgos te /
analyzed: dang por re zhig sngags pas gtsang zhing khrus byas nas phreng ba dang gos dkar po bgos te /
translated: First, the practitioner, having become clean and bathed, puts on a white garland and clothes,

original: skye bos dben pa'i sa phyogs su byug pa byas la dri bzangs dkar pos chag chab btab nas me tog dkar po gcal du bkram ste ;
analyzed: skye bos dben pa'i sa phyogs su byug pa byas la dri bzangs dkar pos chag chab btab nas me tog dkar po gcal du bkram ste ;
translated: in a place free of people, having anointed [the ground], having sprinkled it with white fragrant water, having strewn it with white flowers,

original: stan bde ba la 'dug nas 'gro ba rnams la byams pa dang snying rje bsgom par bya'o //
analyzed: stan bde ba la 'dug nas 'gro ba rnams la byams pa dang snying rje bsgom par bya'o //
translated: and having sat on a comfortable seat, should cultivate love and compassion for beings.

original: aom sva bh'a ba shuddha: sarba dharm'a:sva bh'a ba shuddho& ham zhes brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: aom sva bh'a ba shuddha: sarba dharm'a:sva bh'a ba shuddho& ham zhes brjod par bya'o //
translated: He should recite: Oṃ svabhāva śuddhāḥ sarvadharmāḥ svabhāva śuddho 'haṃ.

original: de nas stong pa nyid mngon du bya zhing bsams nas pam yig dkar po las skyes pa'i padma dkar po 'dab ma brgyad pa'o //
analyzed: de nas stong pa nyid mngon du bya zhing bsams nas pam yig dkar po las skyes pa'i padma dkar po 'dab ma brgyad pa'o //
translated: Then, having actualized and contemplated emptiness, there is a white eight-petaled lotus born from a white pam syllable.

original: de'i steng du aam yig las skyes pa'i zla ba'i dkyil 'khor gyi steng du hr'i: yig dkar po 'od zer gyi tshogs dpag tu med pa 'phro ba'o //
analyzed: de'i steng du aam yig las skyes pa'i zla ba'i dkyil 'khor gyi steng du hr'i: yig dkar po 'od zer gyi tshogs dpag tu med pa 'phro ba'o //
translated: Upon that, on a moon mandala born from an aam syllable, there is a white hrih syllable radiating immeasurable clusters of light rays.

original: de las byung ba'i bcom ldan 'das ma dug sel ma bsgom par bya ste /
analyzed: de las byung ba'i bcom ldan 'das ma dug sel ma bsgom par bya ste /
translated: From that, one should meditate on Bhagavatī Usnisa.

original: sku mdog dkar mo phyag bzhi pa /
analyzed: sku mdog dkar mo phyag bzhi pa /
translated: She is white, with four faces and four arms.

original: ral pa'i cod pan can /
analyzed: ral pa'i cod pan can /
translated: She has a crown of hair.

original: na bza' dkar po'i stod g-yogs can /
analyzed: na bza' dkar po'i stod g-yogs can /
translated: She wears an upper garment of white cloth.

original: rin po che dkar po'i rgyan dang ldan ma sbrul dkar pos brgyan pa /
analyzed: rin po che dkar po'i rgyan dang ldan ma sbrul dkar pos brgyan pa /
translated: She is adorned with white jewel ornaments and is adorned with a white snake.

original: sems dpa'i skyil krung gis bzhugs pa //🔽rtsa ba'i phyag gnyis kyis pi wang bsgreng ba /
analyzed: sems dpa'i skyil krung gis bzhugs pa // rtsa ba'i phyag gnyis kyis pi wang bsgreng ba /
translated: She sits in the sattva posture.🔽Her two principal hands hold a lute.

original: gnyis pa'i g-yas dang g-yon pas sbrul dkar po dang / mi 'jigs pa'i phyag rgya mdzad pa /
analyzed: gnyis pa'i g-yas dang g-yon pas sbrul dkar po dang / mi 'jigs pa'i phyag rgya mdzad pa /
translated: The right and left of the second pair hold a white snake and a boon-granting hand.

original: zla ba'i 'od zer gyi phreng ba can bsgom par bya'o //
analyzed: zla ba'i 'od zer gyi phreng ba can bsgom par bya'o //
translated: One should meditate on the garland of moon-rays.

original: spyi bo dang mgrin pa dang nu ma'i bar du zla ba'i dkyil 'khor la gnas pa'i a'a:hr'i: h'um gi yi ge la sogs pa ji srid mi ngal gyi bar du bsgom par bya'o //
analyzed: spyi bo dang mgrin pa dang nu ma'i bar du zla ba'i dkyil 'khor la gnas pa'i a'a:hr'i: h'um gi yi ge la sogs pa ji srid mi ngal gyi bar du bsgom par bya'o //
translated: One should meditate on the letters A, HRIH, HUM, etc., on the moon-discs in the head, throat, and between the breasts, as long as one is not tired.

original: de nas sngags bzlas par bya ste /
analyzed: de nas sngags bzlas par bya ste /
translated: Then one should recite the mantra.

original: hr'i:yig 'bum phrag bdun bzlas nas me tog dkar pos sbyin sreg khri phrag bdun bya'o //
analyzed: hr'i:yig 'bum phrag bdun bzlas nas me tog dkar pos sbyin sreg khri phrag bdun bya'o //
translated: Having recited the letter HRIH seven hundred thousand times, one should perform seven hundred thousand flower-offerings.

original: mkhas pas rgyan thams cad dkar po gdags par bya'o //
analyzed: mkhas pas rgyan thams cad dkar po gdags par bya'o //
translated: The wise one should wear all white ornaments.

original: de nas bya khyung gi dbang phyug gi mthus bstan bcos thams cad la mi 'jigs pa'i mkhas par 'gyur ro zhes so //
analyzed: de nas bya khyung gi dbang phyug gi mthus bstan bcos thams cad la mi 'jigs pa'i mkhas par 'gyur ro zhes so //
translated: Then, by the power of Garuḍa, one will become a scholar fearless in all the treatises.

original: 'phags ma sgrol ma dug sel ma'i sgrub thabs rdzogs so /
analyzed: 'phags ma sgrol ma dug sel ma'i sgrub thabs rdzogs so /
translated: The sādhana of Noble Tārā Jātaśaṃbhavā is complete.
